android.smartcard
Interface ICardChannel

public interface ICardChannel

Abstraction of a basic or logical card channel, managed by a SmartcardClient instance, connected to the smartcard service.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes this channel.
 boolean isClosed()
          Returns true if this channel is closed, false if this is open.
 boolean isLogicalChannel()
          Returns true if this is a logical channel, false if this is a basic channel.
 byte[] transmit(byte[] command)
          Transmits the specified command APDU and returns the response APDU.
 

Method Detail

close

void close()
           throws CardException
Closes this channel.

Throws:
CardException - if closing the channel failed.

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Returns true if this channel is closed, false if this is open.

Returns:
true if this channel is closed, false if this is open.

isLogicalChannel

boolean isLogicalChannel()
Returns true if this is a logical channel, false if this is a basic channel.

Returns:
true if this is a logical channel, false if this is a basic channel.

transmit

byte[] transmit(byte[] command)
                throws CardException
Transmits the specified command APDU and returns the response APDU. MANAGE channel commands are not allowed. Applet selection commands are not allowed if this is a logical channel.

Parameters:
command - the command APDU to be transmitted.
Returns:
the response APDU.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if command is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if command is shorter than 4 bytes.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the channel is in closed state.
CardException - if command transmission failed or the command is not allowed.
